intro: Seseli montanum subsp. glaucum, commonly known as mountain seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered white or pale blue flowers. Its leaves are typically finely divided and covered in a waxy, bluish coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
